snippet: The American ambassador to Iraq had expressed his dissatisfaction that Shiite militiamen were in the thick of a local offensive against Islamic State.
abstract: Iraq withdraws Shiite militiamen from Sunni-dominated Anbar Province under pressure from United States; move clears way for American-led airstrikes in support of Iraqi forces' effort to drive Islamic State militants from area; American officials had expressed concern that use of Shiite fighters in Sunni area would drive more Sunnis to support ISIS.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and FALIH HASSAN
byline.contributor: An Iraqi employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Anbar Province.

lead_paragraph: The American ambassador to Iraq had expressed his dissatisfaction that Shiite militiamen were in the thick of a local offensive against Islamic State.

headline.main: U.S. Steps Up Bombing Raids in Anbar After Shiite Militias Withdraw
headline.print_headline: U.S. Steps Up Airstrikes in Anbar After Shiite Militias Withdraw

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
